alfredsnippet.snippet:
# clone envirment
conda create -n new_env --clone old_env
# command for offline install

# conda env
# wget anaconda2
# wget anaconda3
# install anaconda2
# install anaconda3

# cuda
# web: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-downloads
wget cuda_9.1.85_387.26_linux.run
sudo sudo sh cuda_9.1.85_387.26_linux.run 
# cudnn
# web: https://developer.nvidia.com/rdp/cudnn-download
wget libcudnn7_7.1.3.16-1+cuda9.1_amd64.deb
wget libcudnn7-dev_7.1.3.16-1+cuda9.1_amd64.deb
wget libcudnn7-doc_7.1.3.16-1+cuda9.1_amd64.deb
sudo dpkg -i libcudnn7_7.0.3.11-1+cuda9.0_amd64.deb
sudo dpkg -i libcudnn7-dev_7.0.3.11-1+cuda9.0_amd64.deb
sudo dpkg -i libcudnn7-doc_7.0.3.11-1+cuda9.0_amd64.deb

# get tensorflow
# make sure using currect pip version
pip3 download tensorflow-gpu
pip download tensorflow-gpu
# to install from downloaded files:
pip install tensorflow-gpu --find-links .

# pytorch
# from https://pytorch.org/
wget http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu91/torch-0.4.0-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl 
wget http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu91/torch-0.4.0-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl
pip install pytorch.whl
